label: ClickUp
description: Arcade.dev LLM tools for interacting with ClickUp

tools.name: CreateTask
tools.description:
Create a new task in a ClickUp list with optional planning metadata.

Use this tool when you want to add a task to a specific list and optionally set
its initial status, priority, scheduling information, and hierarchy.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp list ID where the task will be created

parameters.name: task_title
parameters.description: The name/title of the task

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The description/content of the task

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Task priority

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Task status label (string)

parameters.name: parent_task_id
parameters.description: The parent task ID if this is a subtask

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Date string in format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM[:SS]; ISO-8601 also supported

parameters.name: due_date
parameters.description: Date string in format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM[:SS]; ISO-8601 also supported

parameters.name: sprint_points
parameters.description: The sprint points for the task

output.description: Details of the created task

description.value: Develop and integrate the new API feature for the application.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateTaskComment
tools.description:
Create a new comment on a ClickUp task with optional assignment.

Use this tool to add text comments to tasks. You can optionally assign
the comment to a specific user for follow-up.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp task ID to add a comment to

parameters.name: comment_text
parameters.description: The text content of the comment

parameters.name: assignee_id
parameters.description: User ID to assign the comment to (optional)

output.description: Details of the created comment

comment_text.value: Please review the latest updates on this task.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: CreateTaskCommentReply
tools.description:
Create a new threaded reply to an existing ClickUp comment.

Use this tool to add threaded replies to comments, creating conversation threads.
You can optionally assign the reply to a specific user for follow-up.

parameters.name: comment_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp comment ID to reply to

parameters.name: reply_text
parameters.description: The text content of the reply

parameters.name: assignee_id
parameters.description: User ID to assign the reply to

output.description: Details of the created reply

reply_text.value: Thank you for the insights, I appreciate your input!

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FuzzySearchFoldersByName
tools.description:
Search for folders using fuzzy matching on folder names.

This tool should ONLY be used when you cannot find the desired folder through normal context
or direct searches. It performs fuzzy matching against folder names and returns simplified
folder information. Use other ClickUp tools to get full folder details or work with the folders.

This tool is also useful to avoid navigating through the ClickUp hierarchy tree
when you know approximately what folder/project you're looking for
but don't know its exact location in the hierarchy.

In ClickUp, folders are also known as projects and serve as organizational containers for lists.
Returns folders that match the name_to_search with match scores indicating relevance
(1.0 = perfect match, lower scores = less relevant matches).

parameters.name: name_to_search
parameters.description: Folder name to search for (minimum 2 characters)

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The workspace ID to search folders in (should be a number)

parameters.name: scan_size
parameters.description: Number of folders to scan (in increments of 100, max 500 default: 500)

parameters.name: space_ids
parameters.description: Filter by ClickUp space IDs - limit search to specific spaces/teams

parameters.name: should_include_archived
parameters.description: Include archived folders (default: false)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of matches to return (max: 50, default: 10)

output.description: Fuzzy search results for folders

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FuzzySearchListsByName
tools.description:
Search for lists using fuzzy matching on list names.

This tool should ONLY be used when you cannot find the desired list through normal context
or direct searches. It performs fuzzy matching against list names and returns simplified
list information. Use other ClickUp tools to get full list details or work with the lists.

This tool is also useful to avoid navigating through the ClickUp hierarchy tree
when you know approximately what list you're looking for
but don't know its exact location in the hierarchy.

Returns lists that match the name_to_search with match scores indicating relevance
(1.0 = perfect match, lower scores = less relevant matches).

parameters.name: name_to_search
parameters.description: List name to search for (minimum 2 characters)

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The workspace ID to search lists in (should be a number)

parameters.name: scan_size
parameters.description: Number of lists to scan (in increments of 100, max 500 default: 500)

parameters.name: space_ids
parameters.description: Filter by ClickUp space IDs - limit search to specific spaces/teams

parameters.name: folder_ids
parameters.description: Filter by ClickUp folder IDs - limit search to specific folders/projects

parameters.name: should_include_archived
parameters.description: Include archived lists (default: false)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of matches to return (max: 50, default: 10)

output.description: Fuzzy search results for lists

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FuzzySearchMembersByName
tools.description:
Search for workspace members using fuzzy matching on member names.

This tool should ONLY be used when you cannot find the desired team member through
normal context
It performs fuzzy matching against member names and returns
simplified member information including ID, name, and email.

Returns team members that match the name_to_search with match scores indicating
relevance (1.0 = perfect match, lower scores = less relevant matches).

parameters.name: name_to_search
parameters.description: Member name to search for (minimum 2 characters)

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The workspace ID to search members in (should be a number)

parameters.name: scan_size
parameters.description: Number of members to scan (in increments of 100, max 500 default: 500)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of matches to return (max: 50, default: 10)

output.description: Fuzzy search results for members

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: FuzzySearchTasksByName
tools.description:
Search for tasks using fuzzy matching on task names.

This tool should ONLY be used when you cannot find the desired task through normal context
or direct searches. It performs fuzzy matching against task names and returns simplified
task information. Use the returned task IDs with get_task_by_id to retrieve full task details.

This tool is also useful to avoid navigating through the ClickUp hierarchy tree
when you know approximately what task you're looking for
but don't know its exact location in the hierarchy.

Returns the most recently updated tasks that match the name_to_search with match scores
indicating relevance (1.0 = perfect match, lower scores = less relevant matches).

parameters.name: name_to_search
parameters.description: Task name to search for (minimum 2 characters)

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The workspace ID to search tasks in (should be a number)

parameters.name: scan_size
parameters.description: Number of recent tasks to scan (max 500 default: 500)

parameters.name: include_closed
parameters.description: Include closed/completed tasks (default: false)

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: Filter by specific ClickUp status names. Each list has its own statuses set.

parameters.name: assignee_ids
parameters.description: Filter by assignee user IDs

parameters.name: space_ids
parameters.description: Filter by ClickUp space IDs - limit search to specific spaces/teams

parameters.name: folder_ids
parameters.description: Filter by ClickUp folder IDs - limit search to specific folders/projects

parameters.name: list_ids
parameters.description: Filter by ClickUp list IDs - limit search to specific lists

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of matches to return (max: 50, default: 10)

output.description: Fuzzy search results for tasks

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetFoldersForSpace
tools.description:
Retrieve folders (also called directories, project categories, or project areas) from a
ClickUp space.

Only use this tool when you already have the space ID and want to see the folders within
that specific space.

Important: When users mention a space(or area),
always use this tool to get the folders within that space.

This tool fetches folders from the specified space with support for offset-based retrieval
and archived folder filtering. Results are sorted alphabetically by name.

parameters.name: space_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp space ID to get folders from

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp workspace ID for GUI URL generation (should be a number)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting position for offset-based retrieval (default: 0)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of folders to return (max: 50, default: 50)

parameters.name: include_archived
parameters.description: Whether to include archived, inactive, or deleted folders (default: False)

output.description: List of folders in the space

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetListsForFolder
tools.description:
Retrieve task lists from a ClickUp folder (when users refer to a folder as a "directory",
they mean the same thing).

Only use this tool when you already have the folder ID and want to see the lists within
that specific folder.

Important: When users mention a specific folder(or directory), always use this tool to get
the lists within that folder.

This tool fetches lists from the specified folder with support for offset-based retrieval
and archived list filtering. Results are sorted alphabetically by name.

parameters.name: folder_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp folder ID (also called directory ID) to get lists from

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp workspace ID for GUI URL generation (should be a number)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting position for offset-based retrieval (default: 0)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of lists to return (max: 50, default: 50)

parameters.name: include_archived
parameters.description: Whether to include archived, inactive, or completed lists (default: False)

output.description: List of task lists in the folder

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetListsForSpace
tools.description:
Retrieve all task lists from a ClickUp space by collecting lists from all folders within the
space.

Only use this tool when you have a space ID and want to see all lists across all folders
within that space.

This tool provides a comprehensive view of all lists in a space with support for offset-based
retrieval and archived list filtering. Results are sorted alphabetically by name.

parameters.name: space_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp space ID to get lists from

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp workspace ID for GUI URL generation (should be a number)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting position for offset-based retrieval (default: 0)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of lists to return (max: 50, default: 50)

parameters.name: include_archived
parameters.description: Whether to include archived, inactive, or completed lists (default: False)

output.description: List of task lists from all folders in the space

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetMembersForWorkspace
tools.description:
Retrieve all team members from a specific ClickUp workspace.

Only use this tool when you already have the workspace ID and need to see the members
within that specific workspace.

This tool fetches detailed information about all members of a ClickUp workspace,
including their basic profile information and role within the workspace.
Results are sorted and support offset-based retrieval.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ID of the ClickUp workspace to get team members from (should be a number)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting position for offset-based retrieval (default: 0)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of members to return (max: 50, default: 50)

output.description: List of team members in the specified workspace

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSpaces
tools.description:
Retrieve spaces from a ClickUp workspace.

Use this tool when users ask for:
- Spaces within a workspace (not folders or lists)
- Available spaces to choose from before getting folders
- Space discovery when you need to identify space IDs or names
- High-level workspace organization structure

Note: This is for spaces (top-level containers), not folders (which contain lists) nor lists.
This tool fetches spaces from the specified workspace with support for offset-based retrieval
and archived space filtering. Results are sorted alphabetically by name.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp workspace ID to get spaces from (should be a number)

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting position for offset-based retrieval (default: 0)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of spaces to return (max: 50, default: 50)

parameters.name: include_archived
parameters.description: Whether to include archived spaces (default: False)

output.description: List of spaces in the workspace

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetStatusesForList
tools.description:
Retrieve the possible task statuses for a specific ClickUp list.

Only use this tool when you already have the list ID and need to discover the valid
statuses for that specific list.

Use this tool to discover valid status labels and their ordering/type for a list
before creating or updating tasks, since statuses can be customized per list.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp list ID to retrieve possible task statuses for

output.description: Possible statuses for a given list (useful when creating or updating tasks)

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetSystemGuidance
tools.description:
Return static guidance intended solely to help agents make informed decisions.

Important: The guidance content is for internal agent use only and should not be
displayed to end users.

output.description: Static guidance about ClickUp structure and usage tips

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool

tools.name: GetTaskById
tools.description:
Get detailed information about a specific task by its ID. Also supports custom task IDs
when workspace_id_for_custom_id is provided.

Use when need more information about a task than if it id or custom id is already known.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The task ID or custom task ID to retrieve

parameters.name: include_subtasks
parameters.description: Include subtask information (default: false )

parameters.name: workspace_id_for_custom_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp workspace ID (provide this to use custom task IDs)

output.description: The detailed task response

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetTaskCommentReplies
tools.description:
Get threaded replies for a specific ClickUp comment with pagination support.

This tool retrieves replies to a parent comment using ClickUp's threaded
comment system with offset-based pagination. The parent comment itself
is not included in the results, only the threaded replies.

parameters.name: comment_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp comment ID to get replies for

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting position for offset-based retrieval (default: 0)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of replies to return (max: 50, default: 20)

output.description: Threaded replies for the specified comment

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetTaskComments
tools.description:
Get comments for a specific ClickUp task with pagination support.

This tool retrieves comments from a task using ClickUp's specific pagination method.
For the first call, omit oldest_comment_id. For subsequent calls, use the
oldest_comment_id from the previous response to get the next set of comments.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp task ID to get comments for

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of comments to retrieve (max 25, default: 5)

parameters.name: oldest_comment_id
parameters.description: ID of the oldest comment from previous call for pagination

output.description: Comments for the specified task

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetTasksByAssignees
tools.description:
Get filtered tasks assigned to specific team members with advanced filtering options.

This tool filters tasks by assignee(s) across the entire workspace.
Provides comprehensive filtering capabilities including status and date range filtering.

Important: Use this tool when not interested in a specific task but a set of tasks from
a specific assignee
or filtering criteria that does not include the task title(name).

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp workspace ID for GUI URL generation (should be a number)

parameters.name: assignees_ids
parameters.description: List of assignee user IDs to get tasks for

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting position for offset-based retrieval (default: 0)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of tasks to return (max: 50, default: 20)

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Field to sort tasks by

parameters.name: should_sort_by_reverse
parameters.description: Whether to sort in descending order (default: False)

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: List of status strings to filter by

parameters.name: include_closed
parameters.description: Whether to include closed tasks (default: False)

parameters.name: due_date_gt
parameters.description: Due date greater than (date string in format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM[:SS])

parameters.name: due_date_lt
parameters.description: Due date less than (date string in format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM[:SS])

parameters.name: date_created_gt
parameters.description: Created date greater than (date string in format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM[:SS])

parameters.name: date_created_lt
parameters.description: Created date less than (date string in format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM[:SS])

output.description: Filtered tasks assigned to the specified assignees

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetTasksByScope
tools.description:
Get filtered tasks from ClickUp with advanced filtering options.

This unified tool filters tasks at different organizational levels:

Important: Use this tool when not interested in a specific task but a set of tasks from a
specific scope
or filtering criteria that does not include the task title(name).

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp workspace ID for GUI URL generation (should be a number)

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope to filter tasks by (all, spaces, folders, or lists)

parameters.name: item_ids
parameters.description: List of IDs to get tasks from (required for spaces/folders/lists, ignored for 'all')

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Starting position for offset-based retrieval (default: 0)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of tasks to return (max: 50, default: 20)

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Field to sort tasks by

parameters.name: should_sort_by_reverse
parameters.description: Whether to sort in descending order (default: False)

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: List of status strings to filter by

parameters.name: include_closed
parameters.description: Whether to include closed tasks (default: False)

parameters.name: due_date_gt
parameters.description: Due date greater than (date string in format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM[:SS])

parameters.name: due_date_lt
parameters.description: Due date less than (date string in format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM[:SS])

parameters.name: date_created_gt
parameters.description: Created date greater than (date string in format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM[:SS])

parameters.name: date_created_lt
parameters.description: Created date less than (date string in format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM[:SS])

output.description: Filtered tasks from the specified scope

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: GetWorkspaceInsights
tools.description:
Return a brief overview for a workspace using the latest updated tasks to inform the user.

Includes task summary, team insights, and container(space, folder, list) insights.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp workspace ID to summarize (should be a number)

output.description: Brief workspace overview leveraging latest updated tasks to deliver actionable insights

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateTask
tools.description:
Update one or more fields of an existing ClickUp task.

Use this tool to change a task's title, description, status, priority, dates,
hierarchy (by setting a new parent), or sprint points. You can pass only the
fields you want to modifyeverything else remains unchanged.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp task ID to update

parameters.name: task_title
parameters.description: The new name/title of the task

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: The new description/content of the task

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Task priority

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Task status label (string)

parameters.name: parent_task_id
parameters.description: The new parent task ID

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Date string in format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM[:SS]; ISO-8601 also supported

parameters.name: due_date
parameters.description: Date string in format YYYY-MM-DD or YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM[:SS]; ISO-8601 also supported

parameters.name: sprint_points
parameters.description: The new sprint points for the task

output.description: Details of the updated task

description.value: Enhance the user interface for better accessibility.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateTaskAssignees
tools.description:
Update task assignees by adding and/or removing specific users.

Use this tool to manage task assignments by specifying which users to add or remove.
You can add assignees, remove assignees, or do both in a single operation.
At least one of the parameters (assignee_ids_to_add or assignee_ids_to_remove) must be provided.

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp task ID to update assignees for

parameters.name: assignee_ids_to_add
parameters.description: List of user IDs to add as assignees

parameters.name: assignee_ids_to_remove
parameters.description: List of user IDs to remove from assignees

output.description: Result of the assignee update operation

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: UpdateTaskComment
tools.description:
Update an existing comment on a ClickUp task.

This tool is for updating top-level comments only, not threaded comment replies.
Use this tool to modify comment text, change assignment, or set resolution status.
At least one parameter (comment_text, assignee_id, or resolution) must be provided.

parameters.name: comment_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp comment ID to update

parameters.name: task_id
parameters.description: The ClickUp task ID the comment belongs to

parameters.name: comment_text
parameters.description: New text content for the comment (optional)

parameters.name: assignee_id
parameters.description: User ID to assign the comment to (optional)

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Set comment resolution status (optional)

output.description: Details of the updated comment

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

tools.name: WhoAmI
tools.description:
Return current user profile and accessible workspaces (teams).

This should be the FIRST tool called when starting any ClickUp interaction.

Each workspace represents
a separate team or organization with its own members, projects, and settings.

output.description: The current user's profile information and accessible workspaces (teams). This should be the first tool called.

codeExample.tabLabel: Call the Tool with User Authorization

summary:
The Arcade.dev Toolkit for ClickUp empowers developers to efficiently manage tasks, comments, and workspace structures within ClickUp through seamless API interactions. 

**Capabilities**
- Create, update, and retrieve tasks and comments, enabling direct engagement with team tasks.
- Conduct fuzzy searches for lists, folders, and members to enhance navigability.
- Retrieve insights about workspaces and configure task statuses dynamically.
- Manage team assignments effectively, facilitating team collaboration.
- Execute structured queries for tasks based on specified criteria to optimize task management.

**OAuth**  
- Provider: ClickUp  
- Note: Utilizes OAuth2 authentication for secure access.

**Secrets**  
- No secrets required for integration.
